column13: James Hardie's remuneration philosophy is to provide its Senior Executive Officers an overall competitive package with Peer Group companies exposed to the US housing and consumer durables market. Within this philosophy, the executive remuneration framework emphasises operational excellence and shareholder value creation through incentives that link executive remuneration with the interests of shareholders.

column13: The Remuneration Committee evaluates the remuneration of James Hardie's Senior Executive Officers against a designated set of companies (the "Peer Group"). The Peer Group, reviewed by the Remuneration Committee annually, consists of companies similar to James Hardie regarding certain factors. The Remuneration Committee believes that US-based companies are a more appropriate peer group than Australian-based companies, as they are exposed to the same macroeconomic factors in the US housing market that James Hardie faces.

column13: The Remuneration Committee established an executive performance-based compensation clawback policy concerning performance-based compensation paid or awarded to certain executives.
